intro: Mikania laxa subsp. euryanthela, commonly known as the broad-flowered mikania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and clearings. Its rapid growth and ability to spread vegetatively make it both ecologically significant and potentially invasive in some regions.
